useCase.name: Structural Fire Fighting
useCase.description: Multiple UAVs dispatched to analyze the structure for fire fighting.

preconditions.precondition: Multiple UAVs are equipped with cameras

successEndConditions.condition: The UAVs create and maintain a heatmap of the entire building
All UAVs return to launch without damage at the end of the incident

failureEndConditions.condition: A UAV collides with the building or ground
The UAVs fail to provide an accurate heatmap of the building

useCase.trigger: The Drone Commander activates the fire support mission.

mainSequence.step: The UAVs use their onboard vision to create an initial mapping of the building.
The UAVs plan optimized and coordinated surveillance flights around the building.
Prior to each leg of the surveillance flight, each UAV leases the necessary airspace.
Each UAV performs image capture and analysis using thermal imagery.
Imagery from each UAV is continuously streamed and aggregated to create a current heatmap of the building.
Steps 4-7 are repeated throughout the fire event.
The Incident Commander ends the mission once the fire has been controlled.

esteps.description: The UAV detects a possible victim at a confidence level below the 'victim_detected' threshold but above the lowest 'ignore_level'.
esteps.step: The UAV raises an alert and requests victim confirmation from the human operator.
The UAV continues to stream imagery.
The human operator inspects the video stream.
If the human operator believes that a victim may have been found, firefighters plan and execute a rescue mission.
If the human operator rejects the candidate sighting, the UAV continues its currently assigned route.
